intro: Endocellion sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian Endocellion, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of Siberia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Endocellion sibiricum is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to cold environments.
